Sentencas: Ferritic stainless steel has become a promising material for metallic interconnects for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) operating in an intermediate temperature range (650-800 degrees C).
Titulo: Effect of reactive elements on oxidation behaviour of Fe-22Cr-0.5Mn ferritic stainless steel for a solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: Ferritic stainless steels containing reactive elements (REs) such as Crofer22APU and ZMG232 have been developed for SOFC interconnects.
Titulo: Effect of reactive elements on oxidation behaviour of Fe-22Cr-0.5Mn ferritic stainless steel for a solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: Nevertheless, the effectiveness of REs on the growth kinetics of the chromia-rich scale that forms on the ferritic stainless steels is not yet well understood.
Titulo: Effect of reactive elements on oxidation behaviour of Fe-22Cr-0.5Mn ferritic stainless steel for a solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: The current study focuses on the investigation of the effect of REs such as Y, Ce and La on the oxidation behaviour and scale properties of Fe-22Cr-0.5Mn stainless steel.
Titulo: Effect of reactive elements on oxidation behaviour of Fe-22Cr-0.5Mn ferritic stainless steel for a solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: The results show that Y is the most effective reactive element for reducing the scale growth kinetics and area-specific resistance of the chromia scale which forms on this stainless steel.
Titulo: Effect of reactive elements on oxidation behaviour of Fe-22Cr-0.5Mn ferritic stainless steel for a solid oxide fuel cell interconnect

Sentencas: The growth kinetics of the chromia-rich scale can be effectively reduced by the dominant segregation of Y at the interface between the oxide scale and alloy substrate, and by the formation of a thin SiO2 and MnO layer underneath the Cr2O3-rich oxide.
Titulo: Effect of reactive elements on oxidation behaviour of Fe-22Cr-0.5Mn ferritic stainless steel for a solid oxide fuel cell interconnect
